page.title: 20HAVENSTREET RAILWAY 3
page.content:
ENGINES
The Calbourne, which was the first locomotive purchased by the 'Wight Locomotive Society', is the last of the larger O2 class engines. It was designed by William Adams for the London and South Western Railway. It was made at Nine Elms at the cost of Â£1,5OO. It still runs at the station. The 'Invincible' locomotive, built in 1915, was reconditioned in 1959 and bought for the society in 1971. Since 1978, when it was refurbished, it has been one of the main locos used at Havenstreet. Various carriages, road vans and cattle wagons etc. are scattered around the station. A lot are deteriorating, but parts are used to servive other engines.
